item.title: Floyd add a quote by Tom Baker
item.description: "Plenty of clever children have to pretend to be not clever or else they get bullied by the thick." -- Tom Baker

item.title: Floyd add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "We cannot tear out a single page of our life, but we can throw the whole book in the fire." -- George Sand

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Robert Ford
item.description: "...the grass actually IS greener on the other side, but it's only because of the bodies buried there." -- Robert Ford

item.title: Floyd add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "The more a man knows about himself in relation to every kind of experience, the greater his chance of suddenly, one fine morning, realizing who in fact he is..." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Chris Boucher
item.description: "Fourth Doctor: You know, the very powerful and the very stupid have one thing in common: they don't alter their views to fit the facts; they alter the facts to fit their views." -- Chris Boucher

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Katherine Mansfield
item.description: "The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books." -- Katherine Mansfield

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Jeff Lindsay
item.description: "Mutilated corpses with a chance of afternoon showers. I got dressed and went to work. " -- Jeff Lindsay

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Paul Monette
item.description: "Self pity becomes your oxygen. But you learned to breathe it without a gasp. So, nobody even notices you're hurting." -- Paul Monette

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Alice Sebold
item.description: "Murderers are not monsters, they're men. And that's the most frightening thing about them." -- Alice Sebold

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Ronald Everett Capps
item.description: "See what is invisible and you will see what to write" -- Ronald Everett Capps

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Molière (Jean-Baptiste Poquelin)
item.description: "We die only once, and for such a long time." -- Molière (Jean-Baptiste Poquelin)

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Carson McCullers
item.description: "But all the time-no matter what she was doing-there was music." -- Carson McCullers

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Maybe self-improvement isn't the answer, maybe self-destruction is the answer." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's pathetic how we can't live with the things we can't understand. How we need everything labeled and explained and deconstructed." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Floyd add a quote by Russell T. Davies
item.description:
"Doctor Who: You want weapons? We're in a library. Books are the best weapon in the world. This room's the greatest arsenal we could have. Arm yourself!
(from Tooth and Claw in Season 2)" -- Russell T. Davies
